business.headline: India, US may agree on interim trade deal by June 25: SourcesAn interim trade pact between India and the US may be agreed upon by June 25, according to sources. A team of US officials is expected to visit India next month for trade talks.

Filing ITR late? You can earn 33% more interest on tax refunds this yearIf you've paid extra tax via TDS, advance tax, or self-assessment, you're entitled to a refund. As per Section 244A of the Income Tax Act, the department pays 0.5% monthly interest on the excess.
Want to get debt-free sooner? 5 simple ways to pay off your loan fasterPersonal loans help manage big expenses, but repaying them quickly saves on interest and boosts your credit score.

MSP boost for farmers as Cabinet clears new rates for Kharif season 2025-26The MSP is the minimum price at which the government promises to buy crops from farmers, even if the market prices are lower. It is set every year for various crops to make sure farmers get a fair price.

Sensex ends 240 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; ITC falls 3%The BSE Sensex ended 239.31 points lower at 81,312.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 73.75 points to settle at 24,752.45. Most of the broader market indices also fell due to high volatility.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath explains why India's GDP growth isn't enoughNithin Kamath mentioned that both the government and private companies need to work together to improve education, research, and regulations. Otherwise, many talented Indians may choose to work abroad, and India will miss out on its chance to grow faster.

ITR deadline extension: Why it happened and what you need to do nowEven though the deadline to file your ITR has been extended to September 15, 2025, it's still wise to get started early. Waiting till the last minute often leads to unnecessary stress and errors.

Why the world's ultra-rich are looking for a Monaco addressMore and more of the world's richest people are looking to move to Monaco or at least have an address there. But why is this tiny country, smaller than many cities, drawing so much interest from the ultra-rich?

Finfluencer frenzy: Why you shouldn't chase viral stock tipsCan you spot when a finfluencer's tip will make you money or cost you everything? How much are you really risking chasing the next viral stock? Read on to find out.

Soon, every Indian address may get a unique Digital IDThe Centre wants to bring addresses under India's Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) matrix. Right now, there is no proper system or rule to manage address details in the country.

Belrise Industries share price: Stock lists below expectations with 11% premiumBelrise Industries listing: The company's shares listed at Rs 100 on the BSE, which is an 11.11% rise over the issue price of Rs 90. On the NSE, the stock started trading at Rs 98.50, which is a gain of 9.44%.

Centre proposes bill for online property registration. What it means for you?The Centre has floated a draft bill to digitise property registration. If passed, it could change how you buy, sell, or prove ownership of real estate.
ITC share price falls over 3% today. Here's why and should you buy?ITC shares fell over 3% in early trade. The stock is down 2.02% in the last month, and has fallen over 11% in the past 6 months.
Sensex opens over 150 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; ITC down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 164.83 points to 81,386.80, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 22.25 points to 24,803.70 as of 9:26 am.

Belrise Industries listing: Will the stock make strong market debut? Check GMPBelrise Industries IPO received a good response from all types of investors. By the end of the three-day bidding period on May 23, it was subscribed 43.14 times.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to fall even more today? Check key levelsGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,850.5 at around 8:06 am, suggesting that the Nifty50 may start the day close to its previous close of 24,826.2.

Stocks to watch on May 28: ITC, LIC, SAIL, Belrise Industries, IRCTCSeveral important companies are in focus today, including ITC, LIC, SAIL, Belrise Industries and IRCTC, due to upcoming announcements, stock movements, and earnings results.

Income tax return filing deadline extended from July 31 to September 15This extension mostly helps salaried employees and other individuals whose accounts don't need to be audited. These taxpayers generally have a July 31 deadline each year.
Sensex closes 624 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; IndusInd Bank ends 3% upSensex closes 624 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; IndusInd Bank ends 3% up

Retired before March 2025? Don't miss UPS benefits for you or your spouseIntroduced by the Central Government on April 1, 2025, the UPS provides additional benefits to those who have completed at least 10 years of qualifying service in the Central Government and their legally wedded spouses.

Pakistan's bailout addiction: Why the IMF keeps saving a sinking economyWhy does Pakistan keep turning to the IMF for rescue, but never seems to recover? What's trapping its economy in this endless bailout loop? Dive in to find out.

'GDP means little if it hides empty plates': Analyst on India's inequality crisisIndia's economy may be booming, but over half its people still can't afford three meals a day, notes an analyst. In contrast, smaller African economies like Nigeria, Kenya, and Ghana rank higher in tackling hunger.

Borana Weaves lists at 13% premium: Should you hold or book profit?Borana Weaves' listing was slightly below what many in the market had expected. The grey market premium (GMP) had been showing a possible listing gain of 20-22%, with the premium standing at Rs 43-45 before the listing.

'Could take 50 years': Gurugram startup founder on India matching Japan's lifeIndia's economic journey faces significant hurdles as inequality, agricultural dependency, and regional disparities hinder progress towards matching Japan's quality of life.

Volvo to slash 3,000 white-collar jobs in restructuring move: ReportA major portion of the cost-cutting will come from trimming white-collar roles, which account for around 40% of the company's total staff. Globally, the company has about 29,000 employees in Europe, 10,000 in Asia, and 3,000 in the Americas.

Borana Weaves share price: Stock extends gains after listing at 13% premiumWhile the listing price was above the issue price, it was slightly lower than what many expected. In the grey market, the stock had shown a premium of Rs 43-45 ahead of the listing, which suggested possible gains of around 20-22% on debut.

Good news for exporters as key tax refund scheme to return. Details hereThe Remission of Duties and Taxes on Exported Products (RoDTEP) scheme, which reimburses levies not covered by any other government programme, had been on hold since February 5 but will now resume.

IndiGo co-founder sells $1.36 billion of airline's shares: ReportThe shares were sold at 5,230.5 rupees ($61.35) each, the term sheet seen by Reuters showed, representing a discount of 3.5% to the company's closing price on Monday.

Explained: Why Sagility India Ltd shares fell 5% todaySagility India Ltd said it remains confident of steady performance through the next financial year. It expects growth supported by a strong balance sheet, a wide client base, and consistent business execution.

Sensex sinks 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 2:34 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 931.34 points at 81,245.11, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 252 points to 24,749.15. Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

Olectra Greentech shares tumble nearly 7% in early trade. Here's whyThe stock, which has delivered over 2,250% returns in the last five years, has lost about a quarter of its value over the past year.

Sensex, Nifty fall sharply as markets break winning streak on profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 707.85 points to 81,468.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 225.40 points to 24,775.75 as of 9:30 am.

Explained: Why NSE unlisted shares hit an all-time highThe latest rally in NSE's unlisted shares signals strong appetite in the grey market, where expectations are running high for bumper gains once the IPO finally materialises.

Borana Weaves IPO: Will it list at a premium? Here's what GMP suggestsBorana Weaves share price: The Borana Weaves IPO opened for subscription on May 20 and closed on May 22. It was subscribed 147.85 times in total.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue its bull run today?Investors are feeling more confident due to early monsoon rains and the Reserve Bank of India's dividend payout to the central government.

Stocks to watch on May 27: IndiGo, LIC, FirstCry, Borana Weaves, Tata MotorsThe shares of Borana Weaves will be listed on the stock exchanges today. The IPO received strong interest from investors during its subscription period.

India to become 4th largest economy by end of 2025: NITI Aayog memberIn April, the IMF had said that India is expected to be the fourth-largest economy in the world with a GDP of USD 4.19 trillion in 2025, ahead of Japan.

Rent vs buy? Why young Indians are rethinking homeownershipNot long ago, a house was more than just a home—it was a badge of honour in Indian families. Parents encouraged early buying, regardless of the financial strain. Today, however, younger Indians are rethinking this dream, looking for new paths to stability.

The billionaire blueprint: Inside DLF's ultra-luxury playbookWelcome to the new epicentre of ultra-luxury in India, where DLF isn't just selling apartments, it is curating a billionaire lifestyle and cashing in on the growing trend of 'living life king-size'.

Sensex ends 455 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Eternal tanks 5%At the closing bell, the BSE Sensex was up 455.37 points to 82,176.45, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 148 points higher at 25,001.15. The broader markets also performed well during the session, extending the rally in mid-cap and small-cap stocks.

entertainment.headline: This is enough, sir: Kamal Haasan's name-drop makes Nani's dayKamal Haasan acknowledged Nani's admiration for his work during an interview. The 'HIT 3' actor was overjoyed as his video caught the attention of his favourite actor.

Brad Pitt says settlement with Angelina not major a thing after 8-year battleHollywood actor Brad Pitt broke his silence on his long divorce battle with Angelina Jolie. In an interview, he spoke about how his personal life has always been in the news.

Billy Williams, acclaimed 'Gandhi' cinematographer and Oscar winner, dies at 96Oscar-winning cinematographer Billy Williams, best known for his work on Gandhi (1982), has died at 96, leaving behind a legendary legacy in film and visual storytelling.

Diddy's ex-girlfriend Cassie welcomes third child amid ongoing sex trafficking trialR&B singer Cassie welcomes her third child, a baby boy, just days after testifying against ex-boyfriend Sean "Diddy" Combs in a federal sex trafficking case.

Is Brad Pitt dating again? All about his stylish new girlfriendBrad Pitt opens up about his relationship with Ines de Ramon, reflecting on life under public scrutiny, the end of his divorce from Angelina Jolie, and his upcoming film F1, in a candid GQ Summer Issue interview.

'Child's Play' actor Ed Gale dies at 61Ed Gale, known for portraying Chucky in the original Child's Play films, has died at 61 under hospice care. The actor leaves behind a complex legacy of film roles and controversy

Actor Tamannaah reacts to liking meme supporting Deepika Padukone over Vanga rowActor Tamannaah Bhatia reacted to liking a social media meme backing Deepika Padukone over the recent controversy with filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga. She alleged that it was due to a technical glitch on Instagram.

Zamaana Lage: Metro In Dino's first song explores love and loneliness in cityThe first song 'Zamaana Lage' from Anurag Basu's film 'Metro…In Dino' has been released, highlighting the emotional struggles of four couples in urban life. Featuring vocals by Arijit Singh and Shashwat Singh with music by Pritam, the track explores themes of love, loss, and loneliness.
Black Warrant Season 2 announced, Mismatched to conclude with Season 4Netflix India announced the second season of 'Black Warrant' and the final season of 'Mismatched' with Season 4.

Filmmaker Nidhi Dutta on miscarriage, IVF, filming Border 2 during pregnancyFilmmaker Nidhi Dutta shared her four-year IVF journey to normalise infertility in India. Her story highlights the emotional struggles and strength of women facing similar challenges.

Did Vijay Deverakonda click Rashmika Mandanna's saree pics? Fans think soActor Rashmika Mandanna shared saree pictures on Instagram, sparking fan speculation. Many believe Vijay Deverakonda is the photographer.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli's celebratory pic after RCB's win against LSGAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli celebrated RCB's win against LSG on May 28. A picture of the couple after the match has gone viral.

Bhojpuri star Nirahua, Kusha Kapila join Ravi Kishan in Maamla Legal Hai 2Ravi Kishan is set to reprise his role as VD Tyagi in Netflix's Maamla Legal Hai Season 2. The new season brings fresh faces and promises more legal mischief and laughter in the Patparganj court.

Stolen trailer: Abhishek Banerjee's relentless hunt for a missing baby'Stolen' is a gripping thriller about two brothers on a desperate search for a kidnapped baby. Starring Abhishek Banerjee and Mia Maelzer, the film premieres globally on June 4, 2025.

Hrithik Roshan collaborates with Hombale Films for pan-India projectHrithik Roshan has joined hands with Hombale Films for an upcoming pan-India project. The makers shared the announcement on social media.

Mirai teaser out: Manchu Manoj, Teja Sajja's fantasy film eyes September releaseDirected by Karthik Ghattamaneni, this fantasy adventure film stars Hanu-Man star Teja Sajja in the lead alongside Manchu Manoj, Shriya Saran, among others, and is scheduled to have a global release in 8 different languages in 2D and 3D formats.

Actors Ashok Saraf, Anant Nag, Shobana and others conferred with Padma awardsPresident Droupadi Murmu presented Padma awards to actors Anant Nag, Ashok Saraf, Shobana Chandrakumar, and musician Ricky Kej among others from the entertainment industry. Singer Sharda Sinha was posthumously honoured with the Padma Vibhushan.

Neil Nitin to play Mukesh, his grandfather and legendary musician, in biopicNeil Nitin Mukesh is set to bring the life of his legendary grandfather, singer Mukesh, to the screen in a heartfelt biopic, which he's co-writing and producing. Gathering material from family stories and rare archives, Neil hopes to portray grandfather Mukesh himself in the biopic.

Jennifer Winget, Karan Singh Grover to reunite after 11 years on KJo's show: ReportActors Jennifer Winget, Karan Singh Grover to reunite after 11 years on Karan Johar's 'The Traitors'. The show will premiere on Prime Video on June 12.

general news.headline: My scheduled time comes to an end: Elon Musk exits Donald Trump's administrationThe billionaire's departure comes one day after he criticised the centerpiece of Trump's legislative agenda, saying he was "disappointed" by what the president calls his "big beautiful bill."

US court blocks Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs, cites overreach of authorityA US trade court blocked Trump's "Liberation Day" tariffs, ruling he overstepped legal authority. The court said only Congress can regulate trade.

What does Congress want, Kiren Rijiju backs Shashi Tharoor amid party heatUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday came out in support of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, questioning the intent of the Congress party after it criticised Tharoor for his remarks praising the Narendra Modi government during an address in Panama.

US will aggressively revoke visas for Chinese students, says Marco RubioSecretary of State Marco Rubio said that the US will revoke the visas of some Chinese students, particularly those in critical fields or linked to the Chinese Communist Party. President Donald Trump also urged Harvard to cap foreign student admissions at 15%.

Calm down...4th largest economy is not all cheer, but it's not a tragedy eitherWe are still fourth. Not even a podium finish. No medals. A rank which an embarrassed Indian parent would sugarcoat in front of relatives by saying we are in the Top 5 of the class.

BJP Minority Morcha chief claims 'muslims are descendants of Ram'Siddiqui linked Lord Ram and Krishna to Islamic prophethood and asserted that all muslims share a Sanatani identity as descendants of Lord Ram.

13 stranded at Zero Line as India, Bangladesh dig heels on illegal immigrantsThirteen people were stranded at the Indo-Bangladesh Zero Line after being barred from entering Bangladesh by the BGB and India refusing them re-entry. As India tries to hand over illegal immigrants to Bangladesh, leaders in Dhaka accuse New Delhi of "violating its sovereignty".

US to ban visas for foreign officials who censor Americans onlineSecretary of State Marco Rubio said the US will refuse visas to foreign officials who censor or block Americans' social media posts. He warned that those who threaten free speech 'are attacking one of the pillars of our shared interests, culture, and values.'

Six hours that defied history and death on Mount EverestOn May 29, 1953, Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay created history by summiting Mt Everest, the world's highest peak. On its anniversary, here is an account of the final six hours of humanity's quest for the top of the world.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

Trump demands 15% cap on foreign students in Harvard: I want it to be great againPresident Donald Trump wants Harvard to cut its foreign student intake to 15%, citing limited access for American students. With funding frozen and enrolment concerns, Harvard is under immense pressure.

Lokpal's clean chit to Madhabi Buch on Hindenburg report-based graft allegationsThe Lokpal concluded that, based on the presented evidence and legal principles, the complaints were devoid of merit and did not establish a cognisable offence or a basis for investigation against her.

Brad Pitt says settlement with Angelina not major a thing after 8-year battleHollywood actor Brad Pitt broke his silence on his long divorce battle with Angelina Jolie. In an interview, he spoke about how his personal life has always been in the news.

Karnataka leaders misunderstood: Chandrababu Naidu denies HAL shift claimsAndhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu denied claims he sought to relocate HAL from Karnataka to Andhra Pradesh. He said his request to the Centre was only to establish a new defence manufacturing hub in Andhra Pradesh.

Cried over Op Sindoor codename: Indian-origin woman who was in Pahalgam on Apr 22Vaishali Bhatt, a Singaporean citizen of Indian origin, who left Baisaran Valley shortly before the attack began, said she was deeply moved when she later learned of India's military response — Operation Sindoor.
Bangladesh elections expected between Dec 2025 and June 2026: Muhammad YunusMuhammad Yunus outlines a possible election window amid surging BNP rallies and demands for December polls.

Qualifier 1 preview: PBKS, RCB chase final spot and a break from heartbreakIPL 2025: Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bangalore clash in Qualifier 1, both teams embracing change as they chase their maiden title. While Virat Kohli takes centre stage, this tactical battle between two determined sides promises to ignite the stage in New Chandigarh on Thursday.

BJP accuses Ajit Pawar of undermining alliance, may go solo in civic pollsDespite their coalition, BJP leaders are increasingly concerned that Pawar's faction is strategically maneuvering to take control of local self-government bodies currently dominated by the BJP in key districts.

No cold water, no AC for entirety of June nights for this Madhya Pradesh MinisterMadhya Pradesh's Energy Minister Pradhuman Singh Tomar has announced that in the month of June, he would forgo air conditioning during the night, whether at home, in his office, or in his official vehicle.

Kerala teen skips school to visit town he saw on YouTube reels, traced by policeA 14-year-old Kerala boy who went missing from his school in Kochi was found a day later in another district of the state. He had set out to explore a town he discovered through YouTube reels.

Watch: Brazilian nuns' beatboxing performance wins internetTwo Brazilian nuns went viral after beatboxing and dancing on a Catholic TV show. Sisters Marizele and Marisa wowed viewers with their joyful performance, using music to spread faith and help youths struggling with addiction.

Deporting Mahmoud Khalil for political views likely unconstitutional: US judgeA US judge raised constitutional concerns over Mahmoud Khalil's detention and deportation, calling it likely unconstitutional amid claims it targets political dissent over pro-Palestinian campus activism.

Human smugglers jailed for 10 years after four Indians die on US-Canada borderHarshkumar Patel, the leader of a human smuggling ring, was sentenced to 10 years after an Indian family of four froze to death trying to cross the US-Canada border in a blizzard. The court called the tragedy avoidable and fuelled by greed.

Hamas's Gaza chief Mohammad Sinwar has been eliminated: NetanyahuMohammad Sinwar had stepped into a senior leadership role in Gaza's south after the death of his brother Yahya Sinwar in October 2024. Yahya had masterminded the October 7, 2023, attacks on Israel.

sports.headline: No Jansen, no problem? Time for Arshdeep to be Punjab Kings' hero in Qualifier 1IPL 2025, Qualifier 1: With Marco Jansen away on national duty, Arshdeep Singh will have to step up for Punjab Kings in the absence of his bowling partner in Qualifier 1 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

PBKS vs RCB IPL 2025 Qualifier 1, Predicted XIs: Will Hazlewood, Chahal return?It's time for the Qualifier 1 of the IPL 2025 campaign with PBKS and RCB locking horns in Mullanpur. With Josh Hazlewood and Yuzvendra Chahal set to return, all eyes will be on the lineups of both teams on Thursday, May 29.

Qualifier 1 preview: PBKS, RCB chase final spot and a break from heartbreakIPL 2025: Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bangalore clash in Qualifier 1, both teams embracing change as they chase their maiden title. While Virat Kohli takes centre stage, this tactical battle between two determined sides promises to ignite the stage in New Chandigarh on Thursday.

Big upsets as Stefanos Tsitsipas and Casper Ruud shocked in Round 2Italian qualifier Matteo Gigante sent former finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas tumbling out of the Grand Slam in the second round, while Casper Ruud's campaign also ended prematurely as a lingering knee injury hampered his performance.

Rohan Bopanna, Yuki Bhambri progress to 2nd round, Bollipalli crashes outRohan Bopanna and his Czech partner Adam Pavlasek progressed to the second round of the French Open after securing a hard-fought win over American duo of Robert Cash and JJ Tracy. Yuki Bhambri also progressed while Rithvik Bollipalli crashed out.

Iga Swiatek shuns TV shows to stay sharp in French Open title defenceFrench Open 2025: Iga Swiatek extended her Roland Garros winning streak to 23 matches with a commanding win over Emma Raducanu. The Pole, ranked five, is bidding to win her fourth successive title in Paris.

AB de Villiers slams commentators for negative take on RCB: It got me so angryFormer South Africa captain AB de Villiers criticised commentators for their negative remarks on RCB's bowling during their match against LSG in Lucknow on Tuesday. RCB conceded 227, but chased the target down in 18.4 overs.

Gambhir avoids question on Shreyas Iyer's Test exclusion: I am not selectorIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir avoided addressing questions about Shreyas Iyer's surprising omission from the Indian Test squad for the upcoming England tour.

What makes Shreyas Iyer's captaincy success at Punjab Kings extra specialFormer India opener Aakash Chopra said that Shreyas Iyer didn't have the opportunity to pick the Punjab Kings squad, as he was himself bought in the auction. However, he still delivered impressive results with the team he was given.

Carlos Alcaraz completes special 20 at Roland Garros, eases into Round 3Carlos Alcaraz became the second-fastest man to reach 20 singles wins at Roland Garros since 2020. The defending champion defeated Fabian Marozsan in four sets on Wednesday, May 28.

Sai Sudharsan over Shreyas Iyer for England: Mohammed Kaif unhappy with callMohammed Kaif has questioned the double standards when it comes to Sai Sudharsan being selected for the England tour ahead of Shreyas Iyer. Kaif feels that Sudharsan was selected by his form in the IPL.

AB de Villiers slams commentators for negative take on RCB: It got me so angryFormer South Africa captain AB de Villiers criticised commentators for their negative remarks on RCB's bowling during their match against LSG in Lucknow on Tuesday. RCB conceded 227, but chased the target down in 18.4 overs.

What makes Shreyas Iyer's captaincy success at Punjab Kings extra specialFormer India opener Aakash Chopra said that Shreyas Iyer didn't have the opportunity to pick the Punjab Kings squad, as he was himself bought in the auction. However, he still delivered impressive results with the team he was given.

Carlos Alcaraz completes special 20 at Roland Garros, eases into Round 3Carlos Alcaraz became the second-fastest man to reach 20 singles wins at Roland Garros since 2020. The defending champion defeated Fabian Marozsan in four sets on Wednesday, May 28.

Sai Sudharsan over Shreyas Iyer for England: Mohammed Kaif unhappy with callMohammed Kaif has questioned the double standards when it comes to Sai Sudharsan being selected for the England tour ahead of Shreyas Iyer. Kaif feels that Sudharsan was selected by his form in the IPL.

Injured Casper Ruud gets knocked out in 2nd round shock by Nuno BorgesAn injured Casper Ruud was knocked out in the second round of the French Open by Nuno Borges, who created history on Wednesday, May 28. Ruud suffered an injury in the second set as Borges completed a comeback win in the end.

Shubman Gill is one of best India has produced in all 3 formats: Abhishek SharmaAbhishek Sharma heaped praise on new India Test team captain Shubman Gill and hailed him as one of the best players produced by the country in all three formats of the game. Gill was appointed as the successor to Rohit Sharma.

Suhail Ahmad Bhat gets first India call-up for Thailand friendlyIndian football team head coach Manolo Marquez announced the squad for the international friendly against Thailand on Wednesday. Suhail Ahmad Bhat has earned his maiden India senior team call-up.

Medal rush for India as mixed relay team wins Gold, Tejaswin bags decathlon silverAsian Athetlics Championships 2025: Santhosh Kumar Tamilarasan, Rupal Chaudhary, Vishal Thennarasu Kayalvizhi and Subha Venkatesan helped India defend their 4x400m mixed relay gold medal. Praveen Chitravel won silver in high jump while Tejashwin Shankar battled hard over two days to win silver in decathlon in Gumi, South Korea.

Musetti eases past Galan, Zheng beats Arango, Paolini reaches 3rd roundLorenzo Musetti, Zheng Qinwen, and Jasmine Paolini all secured commanding victories on Wednesday to advance to the third round of the French Open, as intermittent rain and tricky opponents failed to derail their Parisian campaigns.

IPL 2025: R Ashwin slams Rishabh Pant for Digvesh Rathi run-out controversyR Ashwin slammed LSG captain Rishabh Pant for withdrawing Digvesh Rathi's appeal to run out Jitesh Sharma at the non-striker's end during the game against RCB. Pant withdrew the appeal after Jitesh was adjudged not out by the third umpire.

MP Raghav Chadha meets and greets PBKS squad ahead of Qualifier 1AAP MP Raghav Chadha met the PBKS team ahead of their IPL 2025 Qualifier 1 clash against RCB, applauding their league-topping performance and boosting morale with symbolic honours and best wishes for the Qualifier 1 match.

Harry Brook's captaincy era begins as England name playing XI for 1st ODI vs WIEngland have named their XI for the opening match of the three-match ODI series against the West Indies, with Harry Brook set to lead the side for the first time as the new white-ball captain.

Musetti eases past Galan, Zheng beats Arango, Paolini reaches 3rd roundLorenzo Musetti, Zheng Qinwen, and Jasmine Paolini all secured commanding victories on Wednesday to advance to the third round of the French Open, as intermittent rain and tricky opponents failed to derail their Parisian campaigns.

IPL 2025: R Ashwin slams Rishabh Pant for Digvesh Rathi run-out controversyR Ashwin slammed LSG captain Rishabh Pant for withdrawing Digvesh Rathi's appeal to run out Jitesh Sharma at the non-striker's end during the game against RCB. Pant withdrew the appeal after Jitesh was adjudged not out by the third umpire.

MP Raghav Chadha meets and greets PBKS squad ahead of Qualifier 1AAP MP Raghav Chadha met the PBKS team ahead of their IPL 2025 Qualifier 1 clash against RCB, applauding their league-topping performance and boosting morale with symbolic honours and best wishes for the Qualifier 1 match.

Harry Brook's captaincy era begins as England name playing XI for 1st ODI vs WIEngland have named their XI for the opening match of the three-match ODI series against the West Indies, with Harry Brook set to lead the side for the first time as the new white-ball captain.

List of unavailable players in playoffs and their replacementsIPL 2025: The four teams in the playoffs, RCB, MI, PBKS and GT have had to shuffle their squads after quite a few of their players missed out due to national duties.

Jose Mourinho backs Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim with personal exampleJose Mourinho backed Ruben Amorim for success at Manchester United and gave a personal example as a motivating message for the fellow Portuguese tactician. Amorim has endured a rough six months at Manchester United so far.

Day 4 Highlights: Alcaraz and Sabalenka ease into Rd 3, Tsitsipas shockedFrench Open 2025 Day 4 Highlights: Former finalist Casper Ruud has been knocked out in the second round by Portugal's No. 1 Nuno Borges. Carlos Alcaraz has bounced back after dropping the second set to Marozsan of Hungary. Earlier in the day, Jasmine Paolini, Qinwen Zheng and Lorenzo Musetti progressed to the third round with easy wins on Wednesday.

Rohit, Kohli may have felt they can't drive Tests as before: ShardulShardul Thakur feels that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma may have retired from Test cricket, knowing that they may not be able to contribute or drive the format as before. Kohli and Rohit retired just ahead of the England tour.

Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez unveil new Uruguayan club Deportivo LSMArgentine football icon Lionel Messi and his long-time former FC Barcelona and Inter Miami teammate Luis Suarez have announced the formation of their new club Deportivo LSM, which will compete in the Uruguayan fourth-tier football league.

AIFF puts I-League relegation on hold amid Delhi FC, SC Bengaluru protestsThe AIFF's decision to pause I-League relegation amid legal challenges by Delhi FC and SC Bengaluru marks another flashpoint in a season already clouded by disputes, raising deeper concerns about governance in Indian football.

England vs West Indies ODI series: Squads, all you need to knowENG vs WI: Harry Brook's England and Shai Hope's West Indies will face each other in three ODIs to be played at Edgbaston, Sophia Gardens and Kennington Oval.

Satwik-Chirag win on return, Lakshya Sen retires hurt at Singapore OpenSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty marked a winning return at the Singapore Open Super 750, even as Lakshya Sen's campaign ended in heartbreak after an injury forced him to retire mid-match.

Point of the year? Corentin Moutet pulls miraculous effort in first roundFrench Open 2025: Corentin Moutet displayed remarkable grit and determination to earn a crucial break point against Clement Tabur in their first-round clash on Tuesday at Court Simonne-Mathieu.

Jitesh Sharma was spectacular: RCB's Mayank Agarwal after 228 chase vs LSGRCB's Mayank Agarwal lauded Jitesh Sharma's unbeaten 85, calling it pivotal in their record 228-run chase against LSG that sealed their place in Qualifier 1 — RCB's highest-ever successful chase in IPL history.

Can Mumbai Indians, Gujarat Titans win the title? Here's what history suggestsIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Mumbai Indians, Gujarat Titans and Punjab Kings have qualified for the playoffs, but which teams have a better chance of lifting the title?

LSG's Rishabh Pant handed big fine for slow over-rate vs RCBRishabh Pant has been slapped with a Rs 30 lakh fine after Lucknow Super Giants committed their third slow over-rate offence in IPL 2025, with teammates also facing financial penalties post their clash with RCB.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
